CD-RW ?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): CD Topics: CD-RW ?
By farn on Sunday, October 7, 2001 - 02:27 pm:

does monster rancher 3 allow you to use cd-rw cds

By Ray Gamer on Sunday, October 7, 2001 - 02:41 pm:

A short answer would be 'no' because the PS2 probably cannot read most CD-RW's.

A long answer would be 'no' becuase in the manual it describes which types of cd's the game uses (game, music, dvd), and CD-RW's are none of these. Of course, CD-RW's attempt to clone cd's, so, they may work. There are a lot of factors that determine whether they will work or not but they really shouldn't, according to the manual.

My answer is 'Maybe' because you might be able to successfuly make a cd copy of a legitimate cd to play on your PS2.

Hope that helps.

By Lisa Shock on Sunday, October 7, 2001 - 03:14 pm:

I have no idea. The PSX games, MR1,MR2, and MRBCep2 could not read CD-RWs at all. Many people tried. CDRs worked fine. CDRs work fine in MR3. I don't have a CD-RW disk to test with MR3.

By ChetFlavin on Sunday, October 7, 2001 - 07:06 pm:

Cd-Rw in MR3 so far for me (and i only used it once) made a Mocchi. I think it treats Cd-Rw like computer cds.
